casebody.data:
CLUFF v. DAY et al. (Superior Court of New York City, General Term. January 3, 1893) Action by Mary Cluff against Henry Day and others. See 18 N. Y. Supp. 954, and 19 N. Y. Supp. 912, mem.

Argued before FREEDMAN and McADAM, JJ.

R. Owens, for plaintiff. C. E. Wilson, for defendants. PER CURIAM.

The exceptions taken by the defendants should be overruled, and the plaintiff should have judgment on the verdict, with costs.
